text: my name's Richard Ayoade II and I'm the
director of the double so this is the
first scene in the film in which we see
Simon played by Jesse Eisenberg in his
own thoughts and that felt important
that he would almost be dreaming at the
start and his accosted by a strange man
who's played by Andrew Gruen who was
Jesse's double during the filming and it
was very importantly we had a good actor
to play opposite Jesse in to someone
who's able to match his rhythms in order
to film this the train carriage that we
have here is was designed by David crank
we wanted it to not be quite placeable
so that it doesn't necessarily look like
any specific country it could be
European it could be American and the
key thing about the scene was to show
how easily puts upon this character is
that even on an entirely empty subway
train his still willing to yield his
seat if someone asks and we wanted
everything to play out slowly as if it
was in a dream as as if his will isn't
quite his own and that he has this split
mirror to look in to divide himself into
straightaway and his being forced out of
a seat gives him an opportunity to stand
almost as close as perhaps he ever has
to the object of his obsession
Hanan played by mia wasikowska and this
for this character would be a very bold
thing to do to look
with eyes open
